Topic.Title: Mr. Slick ObaMessiah hides pension bailout in Transportation Bill !

Message.Msg: It is certainly a ridiculous post, based entirely on hate of Obama. Obama didn't write the bill (the bill originated in the Republican House), didn't hide anything (the provision is well reported), there's been no bailout (some think the risk of pension failure is higher, which may lead a future Congress to fund a bailout) and Obama is not the Messiah. He is the President. But the provision is there. It basically lets Corporations put less money into pension funds. This leads to fewer tax deductions for pension contributions. This in turn leads to higher tax revenues being collected. Which, ultimately, funds the transportation bill without raising taxes. So that is the Republican plan. Increase revenue by stealing from your pension funds. Increase payroll taxes on workers. Force your kids & grandkids to bail you out later. All to keep taxes on capital gains and the wealthy low. When will you fools realize your getting screwed big time?

Topic.Title: Obama admin secretly tries to avoid Obamacare

Message.Msg: Complete BS. There is no exemption for Congress or staff. Like all Americans they will be able to remain on their employer plans. If Americans do not have access to insurance through their employer they will be able to purchase subsidized insurance for an affordable price on the new exchange or, if they qualify, get on Medicaid. This also applies to Federal employees who may not have insurance for whatever reason. Henry Chao does hope the implementation of the law will allow us to avoid a third world experience. That's because our current system is a third world system and he believes the health law will improve it. Fake ricky is a liar. From his alias to his posts, he is a complete liar.

Topic.Title: Obamacare key author calls it a train wreck and will quit

Message.Msg: You are on Medicare, wilkes. Absolutely nothing changes for you. 2014 will come and go and you will not notice a difference. So you are not a target for outreach. The exchanges are only for people who don't have insurance through an employer or through Medicare. Additionally, some small businesses will have access to SHOP exchanges should they choose to use them. In fact, that is pretty much who the entire law is for: small businesses and those who don't have insurance through an employer or Medicare. Most other people will experience little change, most of it behind the scenes). But you, like the greater majority of Americans, don't have to do or worry about a thing.

Topic.Title: Obamacare key author calls it a train wreck and will quit

Message.Msg: The law is financed mostly by savings from other programs for indigent care at hospitals, savings in Medicare for fraud prevention and new payment methodologies (Accountable Care Organizations) a 3.8% increase on dividend and capital gains tax, fees paid by pharmaceutical companies, insurance companies and hospitals (who will benefit from the increase in paying customers and decrease in non-paying customers) and some other provisions. All together the law reduces the deficit. Compare that to the 2012 transportation bill which weakens pensions and the increased payroll tax pushed for by Tea Brains. Which group of policies do you think really puts additional burdens on the shoulders of the hard working middle class? The hard working middle class now has access to subsidized health insurance on the exchanges instead of being entirely reliant on employers. Which is why when 2014 hits you Tea Brains are going to have a harsh reckoning over these lies you've been telling. BTW, the outreach effort was funded in the original law. After the 2010 elections, House Republicans defunded all portions of the law they could in hopes of weakening it. Now that Romney lost and the law prevailed in the Supreme Court, they have begun to re-fund most of these provisions--with a loss of two of the years built into the law for implementation. The fact is alot of Democratic-led states have taken a proactive approach to implementing the ACA while others have tried to hamstring the law. Republican Governors have begun to realize they're under the gun, and when voters see the benefits of the law in Democratic states they'll turn against the Party of NO! So they are scrambling to catch up, and that (in part) means pushing for funding grants to states for outreach.

Topic.Title: Obamacare key author calls it a train wreck and will quit

Message.Msg: Either you're incapable of coherent thought or you're being intentionally obtuse. But I will answer your questions because I think it will be helpful to others. 1. People who currently do not have access to affordable insurance will now have access to subsidized insurance and expanded Medicaid through the exchanges. This is paid for by the mechanisms listed above. 2. Fraud in Medicare and Medicaid has been a persistent, very expensive and well-documented problem that was largely ignored until the health reform act. You are correct that we do not need health reform to crack down on fraud. However, health reform was the mechanism used by Congress to hire agents (and analytics) to crack down on fraud. The expected savings are being used to offset the cost of subsidized insurance. It's really a win-win effort. 3. By savings I mean changing how we pay for services entirely. Instead of paying for each service (e.g., each hospital admission, each surgery, each prescription) we pay for the health system to keep you healthy. The idea is for health systems to get paid for keeping you healthy and out of the hospital instead of getting paid for when you are sick and in the hospital. Right now there is no incentive for doctors or hospitals to make or keep you healthy. Indeed, the worse job they do the more they can expect to see you, the more they get paid. So we are--slowly and carefully--changing that incentive.
